targets.expr:
label_replace(
$__to / 1000 - max by(id) (max_over_time(container_start_time_seconds{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

round(max by(id) (
  timestamp(container_last_seen{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"})
  -
  container_last_seen{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}
  or
  time() - last_over_time(container_last_seen{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__range])
))

label_replace(
time() - max by(id) (last_over_time(container_start_time_seconds{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id", cpu="total"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
max by (id) (
  (rate(container_cpu_system_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]) )
  /
  sum without(cpu) (rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-12)
)
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

# if container didn't run at some interval, you will have division by zero, so we do ` / increase + epsilon`
label_replace(
max by(id) (
  (increase(container_cpu_cfs_throttled_periods_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]) )
/
  (increase(container_cpu_cfs_periods_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]) + 1e-5 )
)
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_pressure_cpu_stalled_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_pressure_io_stalled_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_pressure_cpu_waiting_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_pressure_io_waiting_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_pressure_memory_stalled_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_pressure_memory_waiting_seconds_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

options.content:
- `RSS` is memory allocated explicitly
- `RSS` + Active   cache -> `WSS`
- `WSS` + Inactive cache -> `Raw` memory usage
- Formula: Cache = Active + Inactive
- Cache is active if it used _often_ (more than once?)
- RSS and cache are exact values
- `Raw` is kernel approximation used for cache flushing and OOM killer
- `WSS` is roughly `Raw` - Inactive cache

What to look for:
- WSS reaching limit causes file garbage collection
- RSS reaching limit causes OOM kill

targets.expr:
label_replace(
max by (id, failure_type)(rate(container_memory_failures_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id, interface) (rate(container_network_receive_bytes_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id, interface) (rate(container_network_transmit_bytes_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)
sum by(container, device) (rate(container_fs_reads_total{container!="", container=~"$container", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__range]))
sum by(container, device) (rate(container_fs_writes_total{container!="", container=~"$container", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__range]))

sum by(container, device) (rate(container_fs_reads_total{container!="", container=~"$container", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__range]) + rate(container_fs_writes_total{container!="", container=~"$container", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__range]))
sum by(container, device) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{container!="", container=~"$container", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__range]))
sum by(container, device) (rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{container!="", container=~"$container", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__range]))

sum by(container, device) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{container!="", container=~"$container", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__range]) + rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{container!="", container=~"$container", location="$location", namespace="$namespace", pod="$pod"}[$__range]))

options.content:
Read/write from NFS and SMB shares
will not be shown in the storage throughput.

Cadvisor exports data from cgroup io.stats,
which are only calculated for block devices.

targets.expr:
label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_fs_reads_bytes_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

label_replace(
sum by(id) (rate(container_fs_writes_bytes_total{instance="$instance", id=~"$id"}[$__rate_interval]))
, "id", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix/?(.*)"
)

list.definition: query_result(max by(human_name, id) (label_replace(last_over_time(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{instance="$instance", namespace="", cpu="total", id=~"($id_prefix)$show_children", id=~"($id_prefix).*($suffix_filter).*"}[$__range]), "human_name", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix(.+)|($id_prefix)")))
list.name: id

query.query: query_result(max by(human_name, id) (label_replace(last_over_time(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{instance="$instance", namespace="", cpu="total", id=~"($id_prefix)$show_children", id=~"($id_prefix).*($suffix_filter).*"}[$__range]), "human_name", "$1", "id", "$id_prefix(.+)|($id_prefix)")))
